Package es.utils.mapper.annotation

Provides the annotation that can be used to configure the mappings operations directly from the Object class.

See: Description

  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    AliasNames
    AliasNames allow the mapper to map a field to another that doesn't have the same name.
    CollectionType
    Collection type annotation allows you to specify the concrete class the mapper should instantiate the mapping element to.
    Converter
    This annotation allows the mapper to map a field to another that doesn't have the same type using, if found, the most appropriate converter given.
    Default
    This annotation allows the mapper to supply a default value for the setters.
    IgnoreField
    Ignore field annotation lets you specify the fields that should be ignored during the mapping.

Package es.utils.mapper.annotation Description

Provides the annotation that can be used to configure the mappings operations directly from the Object class.
The package contains the following annotations:
  • @AliasNames : used to specify the alternative names of a field.
  • @CollectionType : used for field of a type that extends Collection, it allow the user to specify the type of collection to have in the destination class.
  • @Converter : used to specify the converter to use for a field. This is a repeatable annotation.
  • @Default : used to specify a default value to use for a field.
  • @IgnoreField : the annotated field will be ignored during the mapping. If used on a class, it can take a list of string containing the field names or aliases to be ignored.
Author:
eschoysman
See Also:
AliasNames, CollectionType, Converter, Default, IgnoreField
